Rainbow Pendulums

January 19, 2023

Rainbow Pendulum project written in haskell


This was a project I coded for a week 1 challenge in my Haskell course.

The challenge was to simply code the most impressive project using the gloss library. Having recently watched videos on youtube of those satisfying 2 joint pendulums, I decided to code my own in Haskell as it is easy to parallelize in Haskell due to its lack of mutability and side effects.
This was a project I completed by myself, working in the hours around lectures and using mostly just the source documentation for Gloss.

Looking back at it I would have liked to cleaned up some of the haskell a bit and looked further into the equations for the accelleration of an individual pendulum, and Iâ€™m grateful to a friend who suggested rainbow colours as I think it really achieves the satisfaction of its source material.
